result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy G Shoquist

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 22CF558, 22CM98, 22CM202, 22CM228, 22CM229 are called at 8:59 AM) Defendant Jeremy G Shoquist not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jeremy G Shoquist.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court indicates the Defendant is located in Winnebago Health Care Institution under a Chapter by the County. Court finds the Defendant is not competent and not likely to regain competency during the statutory time frame. Cases are suspended at this time for the county proceedings.  
Discussion held with counsel regarding bond on the cases- Court advises ADA Piltz to speak with Corporation Counsel.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Competency hearing on July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am. **CORRECTED NOTICE SENT OUT FOR JUNE 20, 2022 HEARING DATE**

(Cases called at 9:15 AM - 22CF558, 22CM98, 22CM202, 22CM228, 22CM229)
Defendant Jeremy Shoquist appears in custody via videoconference from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Robert Thorson appears in the courtroom.  Attorney Trenton Piltz appears in the courtroom for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant indicated, at the last hearing, that he would complete an application for a Public Defender.  It has since been established that the Defendant is eligible for a Public Defender but that an attorney has not been appointed at this time.  Court reached out to Attorney Thorson (a private bar attorney) for today's hearing and provided him with the competency report.  Attorney Thorson made an attempt to meet with the Defendant, but the meeting was terminated rather promptly - unable to ascertain whether or not the Defendant agrees or objects to the report.  State requests the Court to make an order based on the opinion of the doctor in the report that the Defendant is not competent to proceed.  Court finds Defendant not competent to proceed, but may require the doctor to testify as to the involuntary administration of medications since the Defendant would likely object to that.  State to reach out to the doctor to see if she is available to appear by Zoom today.  All matters are adjourned at this time to be brought back today if possible.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

Cases called at 2:30 PM: 22CF558, 22CM98, 22CM202, 22CM228, 22CM229.
Defendant Jeremy G Shoquist appeared by video, in custody from the jail without counsel.  Attorney Monica Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court has reviewed the Competency Report of Dr. Lundbohm and adjourns the Competency Hearing and the Initial Appearance in 22CF558 so the Defendant can have counsel present.
Public Defenders Office to appoint counsel ASAP and meet with the Defendant in the jail.
Competency Hearing/Initial Appearance: 5/27/22 at 9:00 AM.
**UNABLE TO MAIL TO DEFENDANT-NO ADDRESS ON FILE/HOMELESS**
